channel.title: WSJ.com: World News
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: See How Drones Are Dominating Every Corner of the War in Ukraine
item.description: A sky full of buzzing robots has changed everything about how the war is conducted.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Walker

item.title: How China Curbed Its Oil Addiction—and Blunted a U.S. Pressure Point
item.description: The Chinese government is boosting domestic production and the EV industry in the name of national security. There are 14 million chargers nationwide.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: Opinion | The Fallout From Syria’s Massacres
item.description: Will the U.S. push the Druze and Kurds to capitulate to Damascus as if nothing has changed?
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Trump Arms Ukraine But Still Wants Out
item.description: He’s sending Kyiv Patriot air defenses, but he’s building himself an off-ramp.
item.dc:creator: John Bolton

item.title: Opinion | Europe Will Never Keep Its Promises to Trump on Defense
item.description: The bloc is staggering under the fiscal weight of foolish welfare, climate and immigration policies.
item.dc:creator: Gerard Baker

item.title: Opinion | Toppling Tehran Isn’t Like Sacking Saddam
item.description: There’s a subtle but meaningful difference between regime change and helping Iranians change the regime.

item.title: China Confirms Exit Ban on Wells Fargo Banker
item.description: Chenyue Mao has been blocked from leaving the country because she “is involved in a criminal case,” China’s Foreign Ministry said.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: The Fiercest Border Fight: High Kicks, Mustache Twirling and Very Long Flagpoles
item.description: On the sidelines of the serious conflict between India and Pakistan is another border fight that has reached extraordinary levels of pettiness. “You are a banana.”
item.dc:creator: Aakash Hassan

item.title: Germany Shut Down Thousands of Air-Raid Shelters. It Needs New Ones Fast.
item.description: The country is scrambling to roll back a decision to decommission bunkers as military experts warn that Russia could be in a position to attack Western Europe within years.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Opinion | The Populist Wave Hits Japan
item.description: The ruling LDP coalition lost its upper house majority, as inflation, taxes and immigration help the opposition.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Why Israel’s Chaotic New Food Program in Gaza Has Turned So Deadly
item.description: A visit to one distribution site shows how a system designed to squeeze out the U.N. and Hamas continues to draw hungry Palestinians into deadly encounters.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Europe Prepares for a U.S. Trade Fight
item.description: The European Union still wants a deal, but with U.S. demands growing, the bloc is getting ready to push back.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Japan Election Throws a Wrench in Trade Talks
item.description: A bad night for the ruling coalition could cost the prime minister his job and make it harder to strike a deal with Washington before the August tariff deadline.
item.dc:creator: Yang Jie

item.title: Opinion | Predatory Sparrow Hacks Iran’s Financial System
item.description: The Israel-linked outfit reportedly caused a bank run and destroyed $90 million of IRGC cryptocurrency.
item.dc:creator: Zineb Riboua

item.title: Chinese Rare-Earth Magnet Exports Surge After U.S. Trade Truce
item.description: Despite a detente on China’s restrictions on the critical manufacturing inputs, shipments remain far below last year’s levels.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Feng

item.title: The U.K. Closed a Tax Loophole for the Global Rich. Now They’re Fleeing.
item.description: Instead of paying up, wealthy expats are getting out—sparking questions about whether the move will raise any money at all.
item.dc:creator: Natasha Dangoor

item.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Ordered to Wear Ankle Monitor
item.description: President Trump’s plan to place tariffs on Brazilian goods because of a legal action against the country’s former president has boosted its leftist leader.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Venezuela Releases 10 Americans in Exchange for Prisoners in El Salvador
item.description: Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele said the exchange was the result of months of negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: U.S. Reshuffles Arms Deliveries to Free Up More Patriots for Ukraine
item.description: The Pentagon moved Germany to the front of the line for the air-defense systems after President Trump said allies will pay for additional Ukraine weapons.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: EU Targets Russia With Toughest Sanctions Package in Years
item.description: The European Union agreed to block attempts to revive the Nord Stream gas pipelines and lower a price cap for Russian oil sales, among other measures.
item.dc:creator: Bojan Pancevski

item.title: U.K. Names Russian Spies and Denounces Moscow’s Sabotage Operations
item.description: The British government sanctioned three Russian intelligence units after an uptick of cyber and arson attacks.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.S.-Based Wells Fargo Banker Blocked From Leaving China
item.description: Chinese authorities have placed an exit ban on a China-born executive after she entered the country recently. The bank has suspended travel to China.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Feng

item.title: Iran Is Moving to Rearm Its Militia Allies
item.description: A pattern of high-value weapons seizures shows Tehran is making new efforts to replenish the stocks of its militia allies across the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Adam Chamseddine

item.title: German Startup Wants to Regrow Europe’s ‘Spine’ With AI Fighter Pilots, Drone Walls
item.description: Helsing has tapped into investor interest in the continents defense buildup, becoming one of the region’s most valuable companies.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: China’s New Plan to Encourage More Births: $500 a Year
item.description: Beijing plans to pay the amount per child until the age of 3, but it is not clear if that is enough to reverse a falling fertility rate that poses major challenges.
item.dc:creator: Liyan Qi

item.title: Israel’s Red Lines in Syria Are Drawing It Deeper Into Conflict
item.description: Israel’s demand for a demilitarized zone in southern Syria and its promise to protect the Druze minority are putting it in deepening conflict with the new regime in Damascus.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Russia Says Ukrainian Drones Targeted Moscow, St. Petersburg
item.description: Ukraine’s capacity to strike Russia’s major cities has come under the spotlight since President Trump asked if Kyiv could do so.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: New Details in Air India Crash Probe Shift Focus to Senior Pilot
item.description: A black-box recording and report details indicate that the flight’s captain switched off fuel flow to engines.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Taiwan’s Annual Military Drill Moves Out of the Shadows—and Into Everyday Life
item.description: Missile launchers on streets and tanks near a Costco aimed to bring home the threat of a Chinese invasion.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: EU Warns Spain Over BBVA-Sabadell Merger Intervention
item.description: The EU said Spanish laws granting the power to intervene in banking deals undermined the ECB and restricted the bloc’s freedoms of establishment and capital movements.
item.dc:creator: Elena Vardon

item.title: U.K. Tries to Mend Fences in Europe to Defend Against Threats
item.description: The country of Brexit is shoring up alliances close to home in the face of Russian aggression on the continent and an erratic White House.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Japan’s Prime Minister Faces Electoral Test
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is facing a critical electoral test on Sunday that could further complicate the country’s political landscape and economic recovery.
item.dc:creator: Megumi Fujikawa

item.title: Nationalist Vigilantes Are Now Policing Russia’s Streets
item.description: Far-right groups are filling the vacuum left in Russian cities as many police officers serve in the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: This New Missile-Defense System Is Challenging the Patriot
item.description: An improved European weapon will test the region’s ability to wean itself off American arms.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: Crisis Spirals in Syria With Israeli Strikes on Damascus
item.description: Warplanes hit Syrian military headquarters and near the presidential palace, as sectarian clashes in southern Syria developed into a crisis for the country’s new government.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Canada Limits Steel Imports From All Countries Except U.S., Mexico
item.description: Canada introduced limits on how much foreign steel produced in countries other than the U.S. and Mexico can be imported to help a domestic sector reeling from President Trump’s tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Nvidia CEO Lavishes Praise on China in Beijing, Drawing Rock-Star Reception
item.description: Jensen Huang extolled China’s technological advances and said President Trump wouldn’t mind his meetings in Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Peter Landers

item.title: Through Trial and Error, Iran Found Gaps in Israel’s Storied Air Defenses
item.description: The proportion of missiles that slipped through doubled during the 12-day war, data show, as Tehran found vulnerabilities through trial and error.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: A Day After Trump Promised New Arms for Ukraine, He Warns Kyiv Against Striking Moscow
item.description: The president’s call for Ukraine to avoid hitting Moscow continued his pattern of swinging between pressure on both sides to end the war and underscored the uncertainties about his strategy.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Canada PM Carney Signals U.S. Tariffs May Be Here to Stay
item.description: The Canadian prime minister said it may not be possible to escape U.S. tariffs even with a bilateral agreement to resolve the current tariff row.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Defense Official’s Data Blunder Forced U.K. to Secretly Relocate Thousands of Afghans
item.description: The U.K. government went to great lengths to keep the mistake and its ramifications secret, including acquiring a rare court injunction banning all reporting on the matter back in 2023.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: China Adds Export Controls to Protect EV Battery Technology
item.description: The new restrictions will limit exports of technologies crucial for producing EV batteries and processing their raw materials.
item.dc:creator: Yang Jie

item.title: China Says Its Economy Held Up Under Trump Tariff Attack
item.description: The Chinese economy cooled in the second quarter, but growth was in line with expectations despite pressure from U.S. tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Cheng

item.title: Israel Struck a Notorious Iranian Prison. Its Inmates Are Paying a Price.
item.description: Israel said the strike targeted a symbol of the Iranian regime, but the attack turned out to be among the deadliest and prisoners were transferred to face worse conditions elsewhere.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: China Gets More Airtime Around the World as Voice of America Signs Off
item.description: Chinese state media has expanded its reach from Indonesia to Nigeria after President Trump’s March order to dismantle U.S. government-funded outlets.
item.dc:creator: Clarence Leong

item.title: For Mexico, Trump’s Focus on Fentanyl Brings New Tariff Blow
item.description: President Claudia Sheinbaum has accommodated U.S. security demands on stemming the flow of the lethal narcotic, but hasn’t received preferential treatment from the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: BOE Will Reflect on Steeper Curve in Quantitative Tightening Review, Bailey Says
item.description: The BOE will take account of the rise in yields on longer maturity government bonds as it considers how far to reduce its portfolio of gilts over the coming year.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Putin’s Strategy of Paying Lip Service to Peace Falters as Trump Loses Patience
item.description: The president’s remarks during a cabinet meeting were the latest sign of his growing displeasure with the Russian leader.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Africa Wants Its Critical Minerals to Yield Jobs, Not Just Dollars
item.description: The Trump administration wants to cut deals to secure more of the key materials, but African countries are imposing export restrictions to help develop their own industries.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: White House Weighs Giving Ukraine Another Patriot Air-Defense System
item.description: The move would mark the first time Trump has approved providing a major weapons system to Kyiv beyond the number authorized by the Biden White House.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Russian Minister Found Dead Hours After Being Fired by Putin
item.description: Authorities called the death of Roman Starovoyt a suspected suicide.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Congo Braces for HIV Surge After U.S. Funding Stops
item.description: U.S. funded treatments in the country have helped reduce deaths from HIV/AIDS to around 14,000 a year, from as high as 200,000.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Britain’s Welfare Reversal Hammers U.K. Bonds as Chancellor Tears Up
item.description: Investors fret more taxes or borrowing are likely after the U.K. government abandoned a plan to cut welfare spending.
item.dc:creator: Joe Wallace

item.title: Britain’s Royals Give Up Their Luxury Train in the Name of Fiscal Restraint
item.description: Despite receiving a near-record boost in funding, the royal family has decided it is the end of the line for its locomotive service.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: The Coup Leader Who’s Become an Anti-Western Hero in Africa and Beyond
item.description: Ibrahim Traoré, Burkina Faso’s leader, counts admirers from Nairobi to Jamaica and London. Russia is also courting him.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Congo and Rwanda Sign a Peace Accord in Washington
item.description: The deal opens critical mineral deposits to U.S. investment.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Oil Workers, Snagged in a Dispute Over a Dictator’s Son’s Yacht, Are Freed After Two Years
item.description: Equatorial Guinea’s President Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo freed two South African oilmen who were imprisoned in apparent retaliation for the seizing in Cape Town of assets of the president’s son.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: Air India Crash Investigators Recover Black Boxes as Death Toll Hits 265
item.description: An early focus of the probe includes a possible loss or reduction of thrust.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tangel

item.title: The Man in Seat 11A Who Walked Away From the Air India Crash
item.description: Britain’s Viswashkumar Ramesh said he doesn’t know why he survived, while more than 200 others, including his brother, died. In India, he has become known as the miracle of window seat 11A.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Air India Boeing Crash Kills Hundreds, Leaves Sole Survivor
item.description: The Boeing jet carrying 242 people crashed in a residential area shortly after takeoff. Only one person survived the crash, the first fatal incident for Boeing’s Dreamliner aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
